item.title: Help with PHP please
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Make a new .htaccess file and add this to it:
AddType application/x-httpd-php .php .html .htm

It will now parse every .htm(l) document on the server in that directory.

And about the <? tag, it’s only ment for testing. It’s just bad to use when you finish a script and upload it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with PHP please
item.dc:creator: @Clear Clear
item.description:
@Clear wrote:

Something Like:

<?php
if(@fsockopen("IP", PORT)) {
echo "ONLINE";
}
else {
echo "OFFLINE";
}
?>

Someone also posted : http://rsaddict.com/status.php <-That Script.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with PHP please
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:6, topic:93469”]the best tag is

<?=$blah; ?>

which is

<?php echo $blah; ?>

but in 1 short line[/quote]
I <3 laziness

item.title: Help with PHP please
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

I’m trying to embed this:

[code]<?php
$ips = array(‘84.86.11.175’ => 50000, ‘81.205.144.199’ => 50000);
$checktime = ‘.1’;

foreach ($ips as $ip => $poort)
{
if (@fsockopen($ip, $poort, $errno, $errstr, $checktime))
echo ‘

Server ‘.$ip.’ is online

’;
else
echo ‘

Server ‘.$ip.’ is offline

’;
}
?>[/code]

into an html file and I keep getting this:

[code]50000, ‘81.205.144.199’ => 50000); $checktime = ‘.1’; foreach ($ips as $ip => $poort) { if (@fsockopen($ip, $poort, $errno, $errstr, $checktime)) echo ’

Server ‘.$ip.’ is online
'; else echo ’

Server ‘.$ip.’ is offline
'; } ?>[/code]

(See for yourself at www.zezumascape.com/Server Status.html)

Any ideas how to fix this? I’m good at HTML but horrid at php.

Read full topic
